alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Pecos; Reeves County Plains; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PECOS...NORTHERN BREWSTER... SOUTHEASTERN REEVES...EAST CENTRAL JEFF DAVIS...WEST CENTRAL WARD AND SOUTHEASTERN CRANE COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM CDT... At 452 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Fort Stockton, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Fort Stockton, Balmorhea, Balmorhea Lake, Saragosa, Balmorhea State Park, Fort Stockton-Pecos County Airport, Toyah Lake, Coyanosa, Star Mountain, Pecos Municipal Airport, Girvin, Verhalen, B F Goodrich Testing Track, Toyahvale, Sierra Madera, Firestone Test Track, and Imperial Reservoir. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 202 and 294. Interstate 20 between mile markers 29 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Pecos; Reeves County Plains; Ward
